developerMessage.text:
Recently, Figma made changes to its REST API.

If you get a "429 TooManyRequests" error when importing a layout, you need to upgrade your Figma plan to Pro full-seat/dev or higher.

It seems that even if you have a Pro subscription, importing a project that was not created by your account will apply Free-tier limits.

In that case, to return to Pro limits, you need to copy the frames into your own project and import that instead.

versions.description: First release.
Fixed a bug when installing an asset from the Package Manager.

â€¢ Added Modern Procedural UI Kit asset support
â€¢ Added Procedural UI Image asset support
â€¢ Added more examples
â€¢ Updated designer and developer manuals
Fixes '#if UNITY_EDITOR' bug in BetterButton.cs

â€¢ Updating manuals
â€¢ Small fixes

â€¢ Fixed missing download project button.
â€¢ Fixed cont and img import.

â€¢ Autolayout fix
â€¢ Asset UX enhancement
â€¢ Adding autolayout alignment support
â€¢ Auth fix
â€¢ Added HTTP support
â€¢ Added handling of an error with incorrect permissions of the Figma project

â€¢ Fixed import InputField and TextMeshPro-InputField components
â€¢ Updated manuals and examples
â€¢ Changes in BetterButton component:
    â€¢ Added support for TextMeshPro
    â€¢ Fixed assignment of state sprites
    â€¢ Added 'Selected' and 'Pressed' states

â€¢ Added handling of CloudFront error
â€¢ Fixed BetterButton component
â€¢ Fixed error in CanvasDrawer.cs

â€¢ Improved import process: no need to adapt new layouts in order for them to be imported correctly, very complex frames are imported without problems.
â€¢ Fixed objects positioning issue.
â€¢ Added support for importing objects with shadows - no need to turn off the shadow in Figma, no need to use the TrueShadow asset.
â€¢ Added support for rotated objects.
â€¢ Changed the algorithm for determining common frame elements when importing multiple frames (experimental algorithm).
â€¢ Added support for updating already imported frames - you do not need to remove all objects from the scene to import them again. In case of re-import, the scene will retain the original objects, to which the latest changes from your Figma project will be applied.
â€¢ Added project caching - no need to wait for the project to load on each import if there were no changes in your project. After restarting Unity, the project cache is saved.
â€¢ Fixed issue with assigning non-regular font styles.
â€¢ The 'Custom Prefabs' function has been renamed to 'Design System' and also improved - now the prefabs on the scene are created in the form of prefabs (blue icon), and not in the form of ordinary game objects (gray icon). Added support for nested prefabs.
â€¢ Now you do not need to add a new resolution in the Game tab and set it before importing - this process happens automatically for each imported frame.
â€¢ Added UI manager for easy viewing of frames after import.
â€¢ Added a function to disable sprite compression on import to speed up import.
â€¢ Disabled import of gradients when importing images with MPImage - gradients are imported as sprites, not recreated with an asset, although their colors are carried over and you can enable them.
â€¢ Fixed support for having multiple active FCU asset instances in the scene.
â€¢ Added automatic detection of additional installed assets.
â€¢ The asset code has been completely rewritten, which allows to make technical documentation for it, following which you can make specific changes to the asset that are necessary for your company.
â€¢ Added the ability to move an asset to any project folder.
â€¢ Fixed bugs in localization.
â€¢ Updated manuals.
â€¢ Other minor fixes and improvements.

â€¢ Added support for Shapes2D asset.
â€¢ Updated 'Problems after import' section in dev manual.

â€¢ Added function to convert multiple regular fonts to TextMeshPro fonts at once;
â€¢ Fixed manuals.
â€¢ Fixed an error when importing an asset in Unity 2019.

Fixed:
â€¢ Bug with font assignment.

Changes:
â€¢ Project size limit has been removed.
â€¢ Project download and processing have been accelerated (tested with a project containing 100 frames).
â€¢ Now, to work with the asset, it is necessary to install the Json.NET library.
â€¢ Manual has been updated: information on installing Json.NET via the Package Manager has been added.

â€¢ Fixed bug with detection of Json.NET on Unity 2022-2023.
â€¢ Fixed bug with project building.
Fixed 'Unsupported behaviour' error.

Added:
â€¢ The ability to select during re-import (when synchronizing an already existing layout with Figma), which individual components within frames will be imported or updated, and which will not.
â€¢ The ability to choose which previously imported objects will be deleted from the scene during import.

Updated:
â€¢ The 'Layout Updating' section in the 'Manual for developers'.

Fixed:
â€¢ Incorrect alpha channel value of the gradient;
â€¢ The distance between gradient points.

Changed:
â€¢ The Shared folder has been moved into a separate assembly.

Fixed:
â€¢ Other fixes and improvements.

Fixed:
â€¢ A bug that caused the 'Create Prefabs' function to work incorrectly.
â€¢ A bug that prevented the asset from creating prefabs from a previously imported layout after restarting the scene.
â€¢ A performance bug in the 'SyncHelper' components, present in all versions that have a serialized 'hashDataTree' field in the SyncData.cs script. The bug is automatically fixed for all your 'SyncHelper' components when updating the asset.

Added:
â€¢ The FcuButton component has been reinstated. Relevant sections in both manuals have been updated.
â€¢ Support for SpriteRenderer.

Fixed:
â€¢ Inaccuracies in both manuals.

Fixed:
â€¢ Bug with the addition of extra images that are white.

Added:
â€¢ If an object in Figma has the preserve proportions option enabled, the 'AspectRatioFitter' script will be added to it in Unity. Check the 'Preserve Ratio Mode' option in the Main Settings of the asset.
Fixed:
â€¢ Error logging related to the Figma API.
â€¢ Errors when linking objects in IndexNames and GUID modes.

Fixed:
â€¢ Error when importing asset (name 'UEL' does not exist in the namespace);
â€¢ Error with zero component sizes.

Changed:
â€¢ Improved some asset algorithms.
Fixed the "ProjectCache could not be found" error.

FIXED:
â€¢ The issue where frames of type "INSTANCE" were not visible in the list of frames available for import;

ADDED:
â€¢ A check for the presence of a scene file before auto-creating a scene backup has been added. Now, if you've just created a scene and haven't saved the scene file to disk for the first time, you won't be able to use the asset's "Destroy Childs" function.

ADDED:
â€¢ Support for Toggle and ToggleGroup drawing;

FIXED:
â€¢ Error 'VisualScripting does not exist' when importing the asset.

FIXED:
â€¢ Display of incompatible settings in the 'IMAGES & SPRITES' tab;
â€¢ 'ConcurrentBag could not be found' error.

CHANGED:
â€¢ Renamed the runtime scripts folder to 'Runtime'.

REMOVED:
â€¢ Folder with outdated examples.

ADDED:
â€¢ File with a link to the Figma project containing the new examples.

NOTE:
â€¢ Please delete files from the previous version of the asset before updating.

ADDED:
â€¢ Script Generator (currently without method generation and UITK support).

FIXED:
â€¢ Issue with some frames not displaying when selecting frames for import;
â€¢ Bug in assigning parents in the prefab generator.

REFACTORED:
â€¢ Significant refactoring of the prefab generator.

UPDATED:
â€¢ Developer manual â€“ added a section for the Script Generator, improved the 'Images and Sprites' section â€“ now each Image Component specifies the asset it belongs to.

FIXED:
â€¢ An issue where fonts were not assigned to text components in UITK.

UPDATED:
â€¢ Sprite downloading algorithm â€“ if the size of a Figma component multiplied by the Scale value in the asset settings exceeds the export limit set by the Figma API, the scale will be automatically reduced for the downloadable sprite, ensuring it downloads without errors.

ADDED:
â€¢ A new setting for sprite size limits â€“ you can now configure the maximum size for downloadable sprites. For example, if you donâ€™t want your sprites at Scale x4 to exceed 2048 pixels, you can set this limit accordingly.

FIXED:
â€¢ 'JSON not valid' error.

FIXED:
â€¢ Authentication algorithm for manual token entry.

NOTE:
â€¢ If you encounter issues sending requests to Figma after updating from an older version, please use the 'Delete all sessions' button in the 'FIGMA AUTH' tab of the asset settings and then reauthorize.

ADDED:
â€¢ Special text messages from the developer will be displayed at the bottom of the asset interface. These messages may pertain to all versions or specific versions of the asset.

FIXED:
â€¢ Error 'This instance has already started one or more requests' during authorization in Figma on macOS and other platforms.

FIXED:
â€¢ Non-working 'Image Scale' setting in asset settings;
â€¢ Bug where similar images were replacing each other during download.

ADDED:
â€¢ Serialization of OnClick methods for UITK in the Script Generator tab.

FIXED:
â€¢ 'UitkButton could not be found' error when importing the asset.

REFACTORED:
â€¢ Component rotation algorithms.

FIXED:
â€¢ Issues in AutoLayout import algorithms.

OTHER:
â€¢ Other fixes and improvements.

FIXED:
â€¢ Error installing the import extension for UITK on Unity versions older than Unity 6.

REFACTORED:
â€¢ 'GAMEVIEW' positioning mode.

ADDED:
â€¢ Support for D.A. Button asset.

REMOVED:
â€¢ Support for FcuButton.

UPDATED:
â€¢ The manual for designers.

CHANGED:
â€¢ Other changes in the asset code.

NOTE:
â€¢ It is recommended to remove the old version of the asset before updating.

VERY IMPORTANT: Update to the Figma authorization algorithm.

After February 24, 2025, all older versions will no longer be able to authenticate with Figma due to changes in their API. You must update the asset to version 5.5.0 or higher.

Before updating the asset, completely remove the "D.A. Assets" folder.

FIXED:
â€¢ "Layout Update" function;
â€¢ An issue when adding "D.A. Localizator" to a project;
â€¢ An OutOfMemoryException error in projects that have individual components with a very large number of child elements (e.g., icons made up of several thousand vectors). This has been fixed, but please donâ€™t create such icons ðŸ™‚;
â€¢ A bug in AutoLayout import where paddings could be set to -2147483648;
â€¢ A bug in the object hashing algorithm that caused some identical objects to be considered different during import;
â€¢ Other minor fixes.

UPDATED:
â€¢ The "Manual for developers".

CHANGED:
â€¢ Third-party embedded assets such as "D.A. Gradient," "D.A. Corner Rounder," and "SVGMeshUnity" have been moved to separate folders.
â€¢ UI of the "Difference Checker" window â€“ now you can click on the component name to select it in the Unity hierarchy or open it in Figma (labels "F" and "U").

REMOVED:
â€¢ Unnecessary Debug.Log.

FIXED:
â€¢ An issue where unnecessary sprites were being downloaded.
â€¢ Errors related to the creation of D.A. Button components.
â€¢ Compatibility issues with Unity 2019.3.

ADDED:
â€¢ Search for inactive objects in SpriteRemoverWindow.

CHANGED:
â€¢ Minimum supported version set to 2019.3.
â€¢ Improved the message shown when Newtonsoft.Json is missing.
Fixed 'Graphics.CopyTexture' error.

â€¢ Improved AutoLayout import quality.
â€¢ Ensured compatibility with the latest version of D.A. Localizator.

â€¢ Fixed a bug that caused incorrect prefab coordinates when importing using prefabs previously created by the asset.
â€¢ Added the ability to import all buttons in SpriteSwap mode.
â€¢ Both manuals have been moved to GitBook and are no longer included with the asset. A link to the new manuals can be found in the "Manual.txt" file inside the asset folder.
â€¢ Fixed the error "'ButtonSettings' does not contain a definition for 'TransitionType'" during asset import.
â€¢ Fixed NullReferenceException in the SetupDAButton method.
â€¢ Fixed the font assignment algorithm.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where, during screen import using previously created prefabs, some prefabs were instantiated outside the Canvas.

â€¢ Fixed a hashing algorithm bug that caused some sprites to overwrite each other;
â€¢ Fixed an issue where the color from the object with the 'def' tag wasnâ€™t assigned to the button's NormalState.

â€¢ Fixed a bug where Figma Converter failed to register in the Scripting Define Symbols, preventing the UITK Converter from working.
â€¢ Fixed a compatibility issue with projects that contain a file "Tripolygon.UModeler.Hub.dll".
Fixed the 'Invalid scopes for app' error during browser-based authorization.
â€¢ Added the scripts required to fix the error in "Figma to UI Toolkit Converter."

â€¢ Added handling of request limits for Figma's server â€” a window now provides full details and options to retry or stop the import.
â€¢ Added a new feature to ScriptGenerator â€” custom names for fields and methods, and selection of which fields/methods will be added to the script.
â€¢ Fixed the display of Scale and Compression slider values in Settings.
â€¢ Fixed the interface display in Settings when resizing the window.
â€¢ Hotfix for stopping the import in cases where certain sprites cannot be downloaded from Figma (a more robust solution will come in the next version).

â€¢ Fixed a bug where, when importing using the MPUiKit integration, some sprites were being downloaded instead of being drawn procedurally;
â€¢ Fixed a NullReferenceException when importing with Google Fonts enabled.
â€¢ The FileNotFoundException no longer stops the import.
â€¢ Another issue has been fixed related to downloading images instead of procedurally generating them with MPUIKit.

â€¢ Hotfix for a NullReferenceException when opening the Settings window, which caused it not to open.
â€¢ The Settings window will now open, but the exact reason for the error is still unknown.
â€¢ If you receive errors in the catch block â€” please contact the developer.

â€¢ An MCP server has been added to the Converter, which currently works with Cursor, Antigravity, and Codex.
â€¢ Support for the FlexibleImage asset has been added.
â€¢ Automatic modification of AdditionalCanvasShaderChannels has been added to CornerRounder â€” this automatically fixes visual glitches in that shader.
â€¢ Unity compatibility has been changed â€” the minimum version is now 2021.3.
â€¢ Error handling during import has been improved.
â€¢ The developer manual has been updated â€” MCP Server section.
First release.

â€¢ Asset inheritance has been changed from MonoBehaviour to Selectable.
â€¢ Support for navigation, OnSelect, and OnDeselect events has been added.
â€¢ Missing files have been fixed.
â€¢ The minimum supported Unity version has been changed from 2019.3 to 2020.3.
â€¢ The manual previously included with the asset has been moved to GitBook. The link can be found in the Manual.txt file and also on the developerâ€™s website.

â€¢ The asset's internal interface has been migrated to UI Toolkit; this does not affect Canvas compatibility.
â€¢ The foundation for localizing the asset's interface into multiple languages has been laid and will be completed in the next update.
First release.
Fixed an error in 'ScriptCreator.cs' for the 2019 version of Unity.
Updating compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.
Errors when linking objects in IndexNames and GUID modes.
Updating compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.

Requires Figma Converter for Unity version 3.1.15.
Fixed the issue where the USS file did not get populated with styles during re-import into UI Toolkit.

â€¢ Removed unnecessary margins when importing to UITK.
â€¢ Updating compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.
â€¢ Updating compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.

FIXED:
â€¢ An issue where fonts were not assigned to text components in UITK.

UPDATED:
â€¢ Compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.

FIXED:
â€¢ Unity freeze during layout import.

ADDED:
â€¢ Support for D.A. Localizator asset;
â€¢ Support for Script Generator.

UPDATED:
â€¢ Compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.

ADDED:
â€¢ Support for horizontal and vertical layouts.

UPDATED:
â€¢ Compatibility with the latest version of Figma Converter for Unity.

FIXED:
â€¢ Compatibility with versions older than Unity 6.
â€¢ Updated compatibility with Figma Converter for Unity.
â€¢ Updated compatibility with Figma Converter for Unity.
â€¢ Updated compatibility with Figma Converter for Unity.
â€¢ Updated compatibility with Figma Converter for Unity.
First release.
Fixed NullReferenceException when opening an asset in the inspector.
Changes related to the "Shared" folder. If you are not using Figma Converter for Unity, you can ignore this update.

â€¢ Asset architecture has been changed: the main localizator can now be represented either as a GameObject in the scene or as a ScriptableObject;
â€¢ A limit on the number of localization requests per frame has been added to prevent performance spikes.
  It is disabled by default, since no spikes were observed even when localizing 10,000 components.
â€¢ The manual included with the asset has been updated.

â€¢ Compatibility issues across different Unity versions have been fixed;
â€¢ The minimum supported Unity version has been changed from 2019.1 to 2020.1.

â€¢ The asset\'s internal interface has been migrated to UI Toolkit.
â€¢ The foundation for localizing the asset\'s interface into multiple languages has been laid and will be completed in the next update.
First release.

Preprocessor directives have been added.
The minimum version of the asset is 2021.1.

Added example scene.
The object search algorithm has been fixed.
Added the ability to edit multiple selected objects in the Inspector at the same time.

Fixed a build error due to specifying an incorrect "includePlatforms" value.
Added missing namespace.
Added manual.
Fixed namespaces in commented files.
The minimum version of Unity is defined as 2021.3 instead of 2021.1.
Unity 6 support has been added.
The unnecessary files left from version 1.x have been removed.
â€¢ Added binding functionality. The manual will be updated later.
First release.

â€¢ Added a dependency on the Shared folder (included with the asset) and created the asset config file.
â€¢ The foundation for localizing the asset's interface into multiple languages has been laid and will be completed in the next update.
